organism.name: Slime Mold
organism.description: Physarum polycephalum: A single-celled organism that navigates mazes, solves optimization problems, and demonstrates memory without neurons.
organism.context: Slime molds lack brains, blood, or nerves yet can solve complex spatial problems as efficiently as trained humans. They optimize nutrient distribution across networks and remember locations of food sources.
organism.prompt_context: A slime mold's ability to solve problems and navigate complex environments

organism.name: Mycelial Network
organism.description: The underground fungal internet connecting trees and plants across entire forests, sharing nutrients, water, and chemical information.
organism.context: Mycelial networks create the largest living organisms on Earth. A single organism in Oregon spans 2,400 acres. These networks enable resource sharing between different plant species and facilitate chemical communication.
organism.prompt_context: A fungal network that connects entire ecosystems and enables communication between different species
organism.flux_prompt: intricate botanical tarot card showing mycelial network beneath forest soil, golden threadlike connections between tree roots, sacred geometry of interconnected filaments, art nouveau border with neural-like patterns, mystical scientific diagram, deep earth cross-section, rich emerald and gold tones, engraving style, dramatic uplighting from soil, 4k --ar 2:3

organism.name: Root System
organism.description: Plant roots that sense, communicate, and respond to their environment through chemical and electrical signals, constituting a distributed sensory system.
organism.context: Plant roots detect water, nutrients, light, gravity, touch, sound, and chemical signals. They communicate with each other and with fungi through root exudates and mycorrhizal associations.
organism.prompt_context: A plant root system that senses and responds to environmental conditions through a distributed network
organism.flux_prompt: intricate botanical tarot card depicting intricate root network, flowing chemical signals as golden pathways between roots, cross-section showing nutrient absorption, art nouveau border with branching root patterns, mystical scientific illustration, dark soil background, rich brown and gold tones, detailed engraving style, bioluminescent signal paths, 4k --ar 2:3

organism.name: Bacterial Colony
organism.description: Billions of single-celled bacteria that coordinate behavior through quorum sensing, making collective decisions about growth, dispersal, and survival.
organism.context: Bacteria use chemical signaling to count their population and coordinate behaviors. They form biofilms, optimize resource use, and adapt as a collective intelligence system.
organism.prompt_context: A bacterial colony demonstrating collective intelligence through chemical signaling and coordination

organism.name: Plant Canopy

capacity.name: Memory
capacity.description: Biological recall without neurons: plants remember past stressors and respond differently to future challenges based on prior experience.
